title: Margaret Thatcher: The Autobiography
description:
Tributes to Margaret Thatcher:

Ã¢â‚¬ËœShe will be remembered as a unique figure. She reshaped the politics of a whole generation. She was Britain's first woman prime minister. She moved the centre ground of British politics and was a huge figure on the world stage.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ Ed Miliband, Leader of the Labour Party

She stands as an example to our daughters that there is no glass ceiling that can't be shattered. She helped restore the confidence and pride that has always been the hallmark of Britain at its best.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ Barack Obama, President of the United States of America

Product Description
A newly edited, single-volume commemorative edition of Ã¢â‚¬ËœThe Path to PowerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ and Ã¢â‚¬ËœThe Downing Street YearsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢; this is Margaret Thatcher in her own words.

Margaret Thatcher was the towering figure of late-twentieth-century British politics. Now following her death in 2013, this is her own account of her remarkable life.

Beginning with her upbringing in Grantham, she goes on to describe her entry into Parliament. Rising through the ranks of this manÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s world, she led the Conservative Party to victory in 1979, becoming Britain's first woman prime minister.

Offering a riveting firsthand version of the critical moments of her premiership Ã¢â‚¬â€œ the Falklands War, the miners' strike, the Brighton bomb and her unprecedented three election victories, the book reaches a gripping climax with an hour-by-hour description of her dramatic final days in 10 Downing Street.

No other single book can offer this personal perspective on her formative years, her political convictions and the unique position she came to hold in public life; Margaret ThatcherÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s frank and compelling autobiography stands as a powerful testament to her influential legacy.
